UndBmknZCUi3gCeSz3G6Ig.text: Unfortunately this place has had a corporate make-over.It used to be a simple,slightly louche place serving terrific fish served in a straightforward style,with generous portions and a well chosen inexpensive wine list.Now it serves pfaffed-about food,in small portions,with hugely marked-up wines.And the customers are the braying well-to-do .This is not progress!

4ge9sx4u3Z5MSInmFEjIMg.text: The hotel concierge sent us here. They have a great crab appetizer. We had the cod fish and chips with house salad. The fish was very good and I loved the tartar sauce. We had the lemon torte with breakfast tea. It was pricey but a very good meal.

m0GpR91Yj0SMLFNguTm0dw.text: When in London you have to try their fish and chips!  It's a must!  Geales is in Notting Hill which is very accessible taking the tube.I'm not a big fan of fish and chips but this was pretty good.  The restaurant was nice and the service was excellent.  Overall the restaurant was great from the location to the wait staff.  I really can't say much about it other than it tasted fresh.I would recommend this restaurant for location and service.

tVj4qNiaIIU54oOYjvIJvQ.text: THE place for fish & chips in London! Now F&C has never been labelled as posh food, but when dished out in a smart restaurant with white table cloth, smartly dressed waiters and a reasonable wine menu, you can be forgiven for not knowing. And though the poorper would think £15 is stiff for battered fish, I'd argue that it's very reasonable compared to many other seafood places I've been to. Specially when it's this good!

oenpjEOayZ9ik5gf7FtPLQ.text: It is good, fresh seafood, but quite pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Geales  - London, United Kingdom. Seafood platter

6cftUHXZHOVCyh_zR8W4WQ.text: I'm a big fan of seafood of any kind but it's hard to find a place that cooks the best fish. However, this restaurants comes very close to the perfect seafood place  their food is delicious and you can experience a polite and friendly service.

hPmdtMsaDt3v_PiIgYURFg.text: I didn't expect to be impressed by a fish and chips place, but Geales ended up being one of my favorite meals during my stay in London. My husband and I were pleasantly surprised by the appetizers, namely the fried whitebait and the ever so humble sounding pickled herring & anchovies. Geales has happily shattered my preconceived thoughts of herring and anchovies as being blech. I had never seen herring and anchovies look so fresh, silvery and appealing before.  I liked that they were served nearly whole. Tasted very fresh, and accented by a light pickling and great balance of saltiness and acidity. As for the star of the show...the fish and chips were cooked perfectly. The batter was crispy and light. With a nicely chilled bottle of white, made for a delicious meal overall.

99GSVWKrEaiG_2LdzJ_6pQ.text: Really bland. Mediocre service. Nothing to see here.I ordered the haddock with onion rings and minted peas. The breading on the fish and rings were both quite bland, to the point that I finally salted it. The fish was not very fresh despite my going on a Tuesday. The peas were the best part, and while they were good they weren't great. But, cmon. If the PEAS are the best part it spells trouble.

SwlFggBzVXdKQTPMWH1dTg.text: Quite an interesting story.  I've travelled a number of times to the UK and have heard great things about Geales.  My colleagues and I travelled 5000 miles from West Coast US searching for the "BEST" Fish & Chips.  That is where the excitement stops.  Before we even had a chance to taste or see the "BEST" Fish & Chips in town, we were told by the waiter at the door that the place was booked for the night, OR so we thought.  We checked the reservation system and found out it was completely open.This is extremely disappointing because we expected more from a "classy" restaurant in the heart of Notting Hill.  Was there something about us?  We were three leaders from a world class publicly listed company - certaintly it wasn't because how we were dressed?I am just confused, and downright disappointed.  I guess we'll have to experience Notting Hill another way through another restaurant that cares about our business the next time we travel.What a shame.  What a shame.  I'd still like to try Geales, but afraid I'll be turned away again.

rBTHHz0YO366AE28t3k78w.text: We had trouble eating well in London, but this was one of our favorite places.  We had a reservation for 5 and I was glad we did because it was crowded on a Tuesday night.  We all had the fish and chips cod, except my husband ordered the sole.  I thought the fish was excellent.  He didn't like his sole and ended up finishing mine.  The only negative about the food is that our order of mushy peas was burnt.  It tasted like the bottom of the pot scorched and the burned food was mixed in with the peas,  The decor was clean and crisp so I would dress up a little before eating here.

YFtUrbvejLarsYQcwkcURg.text: This is definitely NOT the best fish and chips in London. We tried the cod and the halibut. Both were O.K. but didn't have much flavor. The chips were not great either. The onion rings were good, but fishy. Service was good and it's a white table cloth kind of place. The best thing we had was the local ale and sticky toffee pudding. If your looking for better fish and chips try one of the pubs or North Sea Fish Restaurant.

TVAUX-Oc2wJo_vnlWtgBPA.text: One of my goals while in London was to search for the perfect fish & chips.    After many misadventures in various pubs, I discovered this gem in Notting Hill.   Without a doubt this was the best fish & chips I've ever had.   Light, fresh and mouthwatering.   And the portion of fish to bread was definitely in favor of the fish.   And their take on mushy peas was incredible.  A perfect complement!   On a repeat visit I had the smoked salmon salad followed by grilled John Dory.  All fantastic.

2hWBZVbFfwwBJFArXiPWzg.text: We were on a walking tour of Knotting Hill and Portabello Road Market on our last day in London.  The guide recommended Geales to the group and said they served the best fish-n-chips in London.  He described to us how to find the place, behind the gate.  After enjoying the market which included a really good whole hog with rocket (arugula) and apple sauce on a ciabatta roll we decided to have our last meal at Geales.  Up to this point I had been slightly disappointed with the fish and chips that we consumed during our week stay.  The fish here was by far the best of the bunch.  You can choose from pollock, cod, haddock or sole.    We went with the cod.  It was a fresh tasting perfectly fried piece of fish.  The batter was much lighter than at the other places.  The chips were nothing special.Also, we had starters of olives,  dill pickles and bread with olive oil and balsamic.  Waiter forgot to bring my onion rings but we really didn't need them anyway.

L1dWUuh51HOLmgODyT1bqQ.text: simple, very good brit seafood. stuck in an odd middle ground price point, as it's upscale fish & chips, but the wine list starts at 15GBP (and continues above 150, if that's your thing) and I felt quite a good value.I called on a thursday night at 8:30 and was offered a reservation for 9:15, which was perfect. The service is friendly, and the atmosphere is quiet and nice. I overheard an older gentleman at the next table tell his waitress that the last time he ate at Gaeles was 25 years ago and it's just as good now as it was then.

0rlnKDVrB_EeigPvoo7sug.text: Wonderful!! I cannot recommend this place enough. Went here tonight with 4 others and we all had fabulous service and food. I had the classic haddock and chips and mushy peas. All were excellent. The fish came served with tartar sauce that was wonderful, the peas were delicious. My friend had the lemon sole with garlic butter and spinach, both of which were incredible as well. We all had puddings, and my sticky toffee pudding with caramelised bananas and ice cream was to die for, truly. I will certainly be back!

9VUSPaQlyMujMjfrybEprQ.text: Gaels is an up-scale fish and chips restaurant.  You can get a variety of fish instead fo the typical haddock.  I ordered the cod and it was delicious.  It was a little pricey but it's worth it.

ia9zRqtxOTDRDhBt1cu54Q.text: Used to come here years ago when it was butcher block tables and strictly fish and chips. Happy to say they still have the best fish and chips. Now it's been upscaled in a very nice way. Nice quiet corner of the world to have a relaxing dinner in. We loved it then and, happily, love it still.

-GVk3ycnLJZlfyYCC9pQog.text: Geales is an upscale chippy in Notting Hill.  The menu is basic but filled with simple, tasty food.  There are few options for vegetarians, but the sides are quite good, and the desserts should not be missed.  The atmosphere is very relaxing and low-key, which makes it a good spot for a quiet dinner out.

dpplj0yYkeyHepj9lFsIEg.text: I never went to the old Geales (pre-2006 at least) which I've heard had a lot of old-school charm, if not the best fish-n-chips in the world.  It's now quite a posh place with a soothing gray/black/white interior - a pleasant spot for a nice dinner out.I only like fish and chips done a certain way and I guess there is a lot of debate as to what constitutes "proper" fish and chips.  The best I've had was actually in Edinburgh, battered just enough to be crispy and eaten with soggy chips and extra vinegar on newspaper.  Unfortunately, the last time I was there at least, Geales served theirs with a thick fried casing and after cracking into it, I was able to manipulate the fish flesh out quite easily.  This is not how I like to eat it.  My dining companion loved his, however, so perhaps it is simply a matter of personal preference.  The chips were at the other end of the soggy spectrum, so I was disappointed there as well.  Finally, we shared a bowl of lobster tagliatelle that was mainly tagliatelle.  We skipped dessert but I did want to try the blueberry muffin with custard... not sure that I'll return just for that.

gHLHn2ZHnuyEoDVabyNb9g.text: ok so its pricey, but it is notting hill darlings. But my god its good.Simple stuff done well and a great selection of specials every week.the staff are friendly, aproachable and very good at heir job.

QGKZi5dPM6lvahUpE7KVVA.text: Nice food, fresh fish, prices little bit high but still affordable. I've eating there dinner with my girlfriend and we were first guest and was too quiet. there was no other customers and no background music so we felt a bit awkward but apart of that service was ok and food even better.

LBIF3QziXp2JJu3WVBjmsA.text: Nice place! Food was good! We went at opening it filled fast. Asked if we had made a reservation so you may want to just in case it gets crowded.

PN49hl0NoL5K8fWYLaeTqw.text: The fish here is fresh and delicious. We are from the USA.We come to London once a year and always eat at Geales.

z2Wge-wVqGbb98g-k8wVVQ.text: Do you know how many attempts it took me to find this place? THREE attempts on THREE different days. I am stubborn and I do not give up easily, I am so glad that I am stubborn. The reason I was so stubborn to come here was yes, the Fish and Chips but it is the oldest Notting Hill chipy. It was first opened Pre-WWII in 1939. Although the look has changed of this chipy, the concept of fresh fish and chips are the same. Maybe why it has been around for 70 years. I needed to come here!This location actually is easy to find after I got lost and figured I would try again.. a couple more times. Plus the third time I decided to go during the daytime, so I could actually see. I used a printed google map because I did not want to use my data and on one occasion I was low on battery when I decided to use my GPS. Notting Hill Geales is tucked away behind modern day buildings on the Main Street of Baywater. There is a little alleyway by the cinema that leads you to an old neighborhood of colorful row houses and Geales! So simple but getting lost has always been a thing for me.I arrived when the place opened so I had the place to myself. I think I came at an odd time because my server was doubling up as the painter for upstairs before the other staff arrived. That didn't matter to me because he was very kind and attentive with the 'Customer first' attitude. The interior was so very sweet, quaint and old with pillows on the backs of the chairs. I took a seat by the window so I could have good lighting for those Yelp pictures. I ordered a Prosecco, the white fish soup and the fish (cod) and chips. Everything came out on a timely manner but I did not feel rushed and I took my time. The Prosecco was crisp and chilled, very nice at past 11:00 AM! The food was excellent! I so loved the white fish soup. Growing up Asian, we would go to relatives or to restaurants and fish soup would be served. I never liked it because of the fishy flavored broth. My mother never made it, thank God! I took the chance and just loved it. The broth did not have a fishy taste, it was creamy and blissful. You could tell it was fish based but it was not overpowering. The white fish was tender and plentiful, plus there were little toasted pieces of toasted bread to dip.Since it is a chipy, I had to go what Geales is known for- Fish and Chips. I chose the most common fish for F & C, cod. I wanted to see how good they did cod. What was brought out was a whopping piece of fish, fried golden over a bed of chips. It was so beautiful served on paper printed like newspaper and a generous serving of tartar sauce. The fish itself was top notch as it was very fresh and tender. The chips were hot and not soggy even with the fish on top. I did take preventative measures and I took the fish off the top while eating it, just in case. Everything was fabulous, darling. Fabulous.This has to be one of my favorite chipies that I have been to throughout the UK and Ireland. For the price, the service, the perfection of the food and the history of the place no wonder it is noted in the book '1,000 Places to See Before You Die.' Now that I found where you were located, you have my love Geales! Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Geales  - London, United Kingdom. Amazing Fish and Chips
Photo of Geales  - London, United Kingdom. White fish soup. Yummmm
Photo of Geales  - London, United Kingdom. Prosseco for lunch

t3izg5zE0prGWFWS_4t4Aw.text: The service was excellent and the fish and chips had a wonderful light batter. Best mushy peas I've ever had. Very pleasant atmosphere.

2xvojCz_TfyjwAig7WsiRw.text: It's what you want out of fish and chips. The new owner has modernized a few things but this is the classic place for fish and chips (get the cod) and mushy peas. You will no be disappointed. Don't forget to save room for dessert!

VuOK0wyA9KFWMyPFbvV1mA.text: Came here a few weeks ago while I was in London for work. I wasn't in the mood for fish that night so I ordered the mushroom risotto. It was delicious!!my dining companions each had different fish and really enjoyed their meals, as well. The weather was nice so we were able to dine outside. Staff was very friendly, too.

KFV5Hc5YntpYm41sTBVbEQ.text: Great food. Started with clam and mussel popcorn. Then Brixham skate and chips. Nice and light batter on the skate. The ladies had ribeye, which was perfectly done.

cUS5yCgvOJcWH7ijniDC9Q.text: Food was very good, loved the local feeling of the restaurant. We ate here on the 3rd night of a week long trip to London and we're staying in the area.Towards the end of the meal, service was a bit delayed, but extremely friendly and welcoming.

np-2iapVGo1J-FqkFrcNVQ.text: Looking for an authentic intro to genuine British fish and chips and found this based on several local references. It did not disappoint!

_4y-lqC6RKrKouQQbeRtrQ.text: Fish soup was excellent with chunks of fish, open clams, and bread filled with goat cheese. The flavor of the soup came from some lots of different seafood. Excellent starter. Cod fish and chips were wow. Best I've ever had.

_Y0vtkk4WUp3Hwcq9kQeOA.text: I find it difficult to write a review for a venue that I'm not that excited about, but I feel that it is my responsibility to inform others that are considering trying it out. Geales is one of those places.Before coming here, I read all of the reviews on Yelp.  The reviews are pretty mixed, and I wanted to discover for myself how many stars this place really deserves.Geales first opened its doors in 1939.  My in-laws used to dine here with their parents.  Given it's longevity, my love of fish & chips, short walking distance from my flat, and the fact I've never been here, I decided to give it a try.It is located in charming Notting Hill.  The decor is a pleasant mix of contemporary and traditional with dark grey high-gloss walls, hardwood-floors, and white tablecloths.  Although Geales considers itself to be a classic fish & chips house, it isn't. I believe a fish & chips house should be casual, friendly and low-key.  This place isn't. The clientele is pretty stuffy, and the host, who was also our waiter had an attitude and was very impatient as he took our order.  He pretty much demanded that we order a starter and sides even though we weren't that hungry.  We requested ice water from the very beginning, and were never served it until we asked a food runner towards the end of our meal.  We all ordered the haddock fish & chips special with a bottle of beer for 16.95 pounds each.  I asked our waiter if I could have my fish grilled instead of fried since this is an option on the a la carte menu, but he said no.  I also asked if I could substitute the fries for a vegetable, and was turned down yet again.  Everything took a long time to arrive.  While waiting I noticed dark food stains on the bottom of the tablecloth near my lap.The only thing positive I can say about this place is that the haddock fish & chips is massive - - the length of the fried fish is about a foot and a half.  The sad part is that about a quarter of the fish length and depth is fried batter.  I've had excellent fish & chips where the golden batter is crisp, tasty and floats in your mouth.  This batter was doughy, heavy and bland.  Two of us had to pretty much dissect through the batter to get to the white flesh haddock. The fries were overly salted as well.After completing our entrees, we weren't in the mood to stay for pudding as sadly the overall dining experience wasn't pleasant.  Even though, this place has been open for over 70 years, I have no desire to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Geales  - London, United Kingdom. Haddock fish and chips

FrFMQZKaiSpWncpU8Yv4HA.text: Geales serves the absolute BEST fish and chips in the world!!! HANDS DOWN, NO QUESTIONS. I admit that one of the primary reasons for our trip to London was to find the best fish and chips so I was giddy after eating here. Mission accomplished. There are a few different fish options. I would suggest to stick with the cod. We ordered the sole as well which was still delicious, but the cod was much flakier and "meatier." The fry was absolute PERFECTION. A good fish and chips should be light, crisp, and poufy - meaning elevated and separated from the fish. None of this soggy mushy nonsense offered in the States. Geales executed this to the tee. Add some malt vinegar and aoli, take a swig of your London's Pride beer, and this will send you right into food heaven.Geales alone can warrant another trip back to London. A bit on the pricey side for fish and chips but it is an upscale restaurant and the best fish and chips in the world makes it worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Geales  - London, United Kingdom. Mushy peas
Photo of Geales  - London, United Kingdom. Sole
Photo of Geales  - London, United Kingdom. Cod in the front, sole in the back

OFHxpqSlStWYZ3g8cDipBA.text: Loved the location of this place. Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the Notting Hill Gate station area is Geales. We had the chance to soak in the sun and sat in their outside seating. Both of us tried the cod fish and chips. I went with the lunch special which was very reasonably priced. The salad that came with it was much better than I expected in terms of quality of ingredients and size. Fish was fresh and moist and the chips were crispy! Great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Geales  - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Geales  - London, United Kingdom

16l6he0OHjvT6-XBAKTmAw.text: Not really worth the prices, IMHO. Being a visitor, I was expecting great fish and chips (£16) but it was nothing spectacular. The fish pie had plenty of seafood, was kind of hearty and filling, but tasted quite bland. The risotto, on the other hand, was flavorful enough but was presented poorly. Note we were the only patrons for the entire time we were there for lunch, and that's never a good sign. The young dudes running the place were ok-friendly and helpful though, so good luck lads!

s-ugo8dtUIsc-GSUaArjqw.text: Oh my God, what a massive disappointment! A friend in Manhattan, a former Londoner herself, recommended this place for our London holiday. She will be appalled when I tell her our experience. The host (?) seated us in an isolated spot-mind you, the restaurant was dead on a Wednesday evening, which is not a good sign in itself-then left us without menus. We easily sat for 10 minutes waiting for our waiter. At last, the host returned with menus, and was clearly disgusted-disappointed-contemptuous when we did not order drinks. How dare we! Such plebeians. He then took our order-oh wait, he's now our waiter I guess-and was clearly eager to get us out of there. He showed zero pride in the restaurant, zero pride in his job, zero enthusiasm to share the menu with us. We clearly were not the type of people he could suck up to. After ordering, he went away, returned to our vicinity to glance at an empty, still dirty table. For some reason, he yelled to a co-worker who was clearly invisible or in a different part of the restaurant entirely. Why he yelled, I do not know, but clearly this didn't strike him as being the least bit inappropriate. The food came, was decent, but not at all worth the price and inexcusable treatment. Thank heavens my wife saw someone with a carafe of water, and had asked our waiter-host to bring one. He certainly never came back to check if we were happy with our meals or needed anything else. Just an FYI for management, we saw we were being treated badly early on, and decided to eat-drink as little as possible, so as not to waste our money on a bad experience. Leaving the restaurant, we encountered the waiter-host in the front door. I said good evening. He said nothing. (The waiter-host was Lorenzo. We dined on 13 April 2016, receipt number 14460, VAT #778706673) We've had some wonderful and some bad experiences in London so far, but Geales of Notting Hill is setting a terrible example for your city.

1sWvcWRQxaRUKPQoPw_EJg.text: The fish that day was Haddock. I determined I don't like Haddock. The restaurant itself is quiet and intimate. I plan on giving it another chance.

siOos3aP1ZAzWI6oomrbRQ.text: This is a very lovely place in the Notting Hill area. Hub and I literally searched all pubs and restaurants that offers the best beer battered fish and chips. And we def found it here. Among their local fav is the sticky toffee pudding that was not listed on the menu.So good that I wish we were on the next flight to London. No reservations required but most locals do. Waitress was very attentive and friendly. We also had their Shepard's pie and it was delicious. The entrees also came with salad and a bread basket. And Geales is also known for their fresh seafood. We would love to come back for a future visit.

u4l135vlWqHwO3HrOohSqQ.text: Bad bad bad. Below average fish and chips. Greasy, soggy, and lacking flavor.  Plus, they made us wait over an hour for it and were rude. Like it was somehow our fault they forgot to put in our order.  Twice.  Didn't even offer us a free drink to lay over while we waited for the food.  And it wasn't like the place was busy.  Definitely not worth walking over a mile to get here like I did. Fail.  Avoid this place.

iZd3nvK2OMICMkEkY8EXQw.text: It was our last day in London and I craved the traditional fish and chips meal before departing.  Our tour guide earlier in the day suggested this restaurant in Notting Hill for the best "chippys" in the neighborhood.  We were fortunate as we walk in without reservations and got the last available table! The service was excellent as it seemed to be a team effort for drinks, food, etc.  The fish was fresh and fried lightly...and my mushy peas were the best! I loved the location and the ambiance of the restaurant and was very pleased to have found it on our last night.

photos.caption: Photo of Geales  - London, United Kingdom. The best fish & chips!! And mushy peas...

nKnJPLgTFfNvBkJy6YfxVQ.text: They also have some fewselections of vegetarian foods and desserts. The atmosphere is very relaxing,and the service is great. Really a perfect spot that you shouldn't missed.Highly recommended one.
